title: No, Modi Government Hasn’t Slashed Funds for Higher Education
subtitle: FACT CHECK: A viral message claims that Prime Minister Narendra Modi led government has slashed the funds for higher education in 2009. It also claims that in 2009 the funds were Rs 2900 crore which has now gone down to Rs 400 crore.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
The Quint checked the budget allocated to higher education under the Ministry of Human Resource and Development (MHRD) to find out if the funds have indeed been slashed.

We looked at the data from 2008-2009, 2009-2010 and 2018-2019, 2019-2020, due to the ambiguous claim that doesn’t mention the financial year it has taken into consideration.

According to the data on the Indian Union Budget website, the amount budgeted by the Union government for higher education for financial year 2008-2009 was Rs 10,852.87 crore. Similarly, the budgeted amount for 2009-2010 was Rs 15,429.00 crore.
